alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 3:57PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Pike County through 430 PM EST... At 356 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chattaroy to Coleman to Breaks Interstate. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Board Tree, Phelps, Jamboree, Aflex and South Williamson around 400 PM EST. Majestic, Biggs and Hardy around 405 PM EST. Paw Paw and Argo around 415 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Woodman. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 18 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
